title: Over USD 35M payment settled for diesel shipment
content: A payment of USD 35.6 million has been made for the release of 37,500 MT of diesel from a Singaporean tanker docked outside the Colombo Port.The diesel stocks will be unloaded soon, secretary to the Ministry of Energy K.D.R. Olga said.She said the payments were made for the petrol tanker last Saturday, but unloading has been delayed owing to technical issues faced during the opening of credit letters.There is no shortage of petrol in the country, Olga claimed, adding that the fresh stocks will be distributed systematically today.
